result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin Wayne Demars was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DNA sample if not already given and the surcharge.

Not allowed to possess firearms.  Not allowed to vote or sit on jury until civil rights are restored.   Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.    Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  No possession or consumption of prescription medications without a valid prescription and then only according to Dr.'s orders.  All prescriptions shall be verified by agent.

The defendant will be initially supervised based on DOC evaluation.  Payment of any restitution, court obligations and DOC supervision fees.  Maintain full time employment.    Enter into, participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations and/or treatment programs as directed by the agent.  AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare; if any portion takes place within a state penal institution, continuation of accepted aftercare treatment upon release to extended supervision.  Successfully complete a cognitive intervention program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
